newsitem.title: FRANCE: French mustachioed bank robbers were women.
newsitem.headline: French mustachioed bank robbers were women.

text.p: A gang of five women accused of robbing banks at gunpoint while disguised as men went on trial on Wednesday in the southern French town of Carpentras.
Wearing wigs and false moustaches, the women allegedly held up seven banks and a temporary employment agency in the southern Vaucluse region during 1989 and 1990.
They took in an estimated 290,000 francs ($56,300) during an 18-month period before their arrest in July 1991, prosecutors alleged.
Freed while awaiting trial, the women have since found jobs ranging from maid to town hall employee.
Their trial on charges of armed robbery, conspiracy and being accomplices to theft was expected to last three days.
